title: On changepoint detection in functional data using empirical energy distance. (arXiv:2310.04853v1 [stat.ME])
abstract: We propose a novel family of test statistics to detect the presence of changepoints in a sequence of dependent, possibly multivariate, functional-valued observations. Our approach allows to test for a very general class of changepoints, including the "classical" case of changes in the mean, and even changes in the whole distribution. Our statistics are based on a generalisation of the empirical energy distance; we propose weighted functionals of the energy distance process, which are designed in order to enhance the ability to detect breaks occurring at sample endpoints. The limiting distribution of the maximally selected version of our statistics requires only the computation of the eigenvalues of the covariance function, thus being readily implementable in the most commonly employed packages, e.g. R. We show that, under the alternative, our statistics are able to detect changepoints occurring even very close to the beginning/end of the sample. In the presence of multiple changepoints

translated_title: 通过经验能量距离在函数数据中检测变点
translated_abstract: 我们提出了一种新颖的检测方法，用于在一系列相关的可能为多元的函数值观测中检测变点的存在。我们的方法可以测试一个非常通用的变点类别，包括经典的均值变化以及整个分布的变化。我们的统计量基于经验能量距离的推广；我们提出了能量距离过程的加权泛函，旨在提高检测样本端点处断点的能力。我们的统计量的极大选择版本的极限分布只需要计算协方差函数的特征值，因此可以在最常用的软件包（如R）中方便地实施。我们证明，在替代假设下，我们的统计量能够检测甚至非常靠近样本开头/结尾处的变点。在存在多个变点的情况下...
tldr: 本文提出了一种使用经验能量距离在函数数据中检测变点的新方法，可用于测试一系列变点类别，包括均值变化和整个分布的变化。该方法提出了加权能量距离过程的统计量，能够在样本端点处增强检测能力，并且可以直接在常用的软件包中实现。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a new method for detecting changepoints in functional data using the empirical energy distance. The method can test a wide range of changepoint categories, including changes in mean and changes in the entire distribution. The proposed method utilizes weighted functionals of the energy distance process to enhance detection capability at sample endpoints, and can be readily implemented in commonly used software packages.
